orders.com

This sample application is a ficticious order entry / inventory management system. All efforts were made to keep these applications as simple as possible to focus on how a middle tier can be written with peasy-js and consumed by multiple clients (client and server).

This application was developed with peasy-js and reactjs. It can be configured to consume in-memory data proxies or to communicate with the web api via http data proxies.

This application was developed with peasy-js and angular. It can be configured to consume in-memory data proxies or to communicate with the web api via http data proxies.

This web api application was developed with peasy-js, express, mongodb, and nodejs. It consumes the business logic written with peasy-js. The react & angular sample applications are configured to communicate with this api by default.

This is a super simple demo that shows how a plain javascript app might consume your business logic with peasy-js

Let's go!
